result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:24 AM Defendant Robert J Kelly in court.  Attorney Breanne Marie Bucher in court for Robert J Kelly. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

Defense has discovery, and reviewed. Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing in February. State does not object. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

10:07 AM Defendant Robert J Kelly in court.  Attorney Breanne Marie Bucher in court for Robert J Kelly.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that this case was recently amended to an OWI 3rd, and that the State has recently extended an offer. Defense requests another date to review case and offer with the client. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am. **Rescheduled due to a conflict with the Court's Calendar.**

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J Kelly in court with attorney Breanne Marie Bucher.   
Court to Address:  State's Motion to File an Amended Information.

Defense has no objections to the filing of the amended information.
Court Grants - Amended information allowed to be filed.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.
MATTER NOW BECOMES A MISDEMEANOR.

  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion to File Amended Information, filed by the State.

09:46 AM Defendant Robert J Kelly in court with attorney Breanne Marie Bucher.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.

The State does not object.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.
The Court will adjourn.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 04-05-2022 received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody or payment of bail.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
